abstract: Yahoo finally looks ready to do a deal, according to BusinessWeek, which cited people familiar with the situation. Pressure from large shareholders, including Carl C. Icahn and hedge fund Paulson & Company, has persuaded Yahoo to work out a transaction with Microsoft, or alternatively, with Google, according to the magazine.
lead_paragraph: Yahoo finally looks ready to do a deal, according to BusinessWeek, which cited people familiar with the situation. Pressure from large shareholders, including Carl C. Icahn and hedge fund Paulson & Company, has persuaded Yahoo to work out a transaction with Microsoft, or alternatively, with Google, according to the magazine.

headline.main: A Deal For Yahoo May Be Nigh, Report Says

abstract: Microsoft‘s attempts to strike a deal with Yahoo is an “accelerator” of its online strategy, but not the sole answer to advancing its Internet vision, the company’s top software executive said on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: Microsoft‘s attempts to strike a deal with Yahoo is an “accelerator” of its online strategy, but not the sole answer to advancing its Internet vision, the company’s top software executive said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Microsoft Executive Says Yahoo Would ‘Accelerate’ Online Plans
